jcr:content.jcr:title: Mother, Mother, Mother Pin a Rose on Me

contentheadline.headline: Mother, Mother, Mother Pin a Rose on Me

contentrichtext.text: '''''Mother, Mother, Mother Pin a Rose on Me''''' ([[1924 in film|1924]]) is a film, produced by [[Fleischer Studios|Out of the Inkwell Studios, Inc.]] and released in June 1924, as part of the [[Sound Car-Tunes|Song Car-Tunes]] series. Early titles in the Song Car-Tunes series were ''Oh Mabel'', ''Come Take A Trip in My Airship'', and ''Goodbye My Lady Love'', all released in May and June 1924. They were the first sound cartoons, not Disney's ''[[Steamboat Willie]]'' (1928), as often is thought. "Mother, Mother, Mother Pin a Rose on Me" is a popular song from 1905. ==External links== *[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0141617/ ''Mother, Mother, Mother Pin a Rose on Me'' at the Internet Movie Database] *[http://www.silentera.com/PSFL/data/M/MotherMotherMotherPina1924.html SilentEra entry] [[Category:1924 films]] [[Category:Animated short films]] [[Category:1920s comedy films]] [[Category:Fleischer Studios short films]] [[Category:Black-and-white films]] {{short-animation-film-stub}}
